translation.ja: ドールズ目当てに いつも演奏を聞きに行っていた場所よ

translation.en: and other people, but especially the Dolls.
translation.ja: いつも演奏を聞きに行っていた場所よ

translation.en: Um, and then, one day, it just fell down.
translation.ja: そこが突然なくなったの

translation.en: -[Martin] Mm-hmm. -[Fran] The building just fell down. That was the level of neglect.
translation.ja: でも誰も驚かなかった

translation.en: When people said, "Did you hear the Mercer Arts Center fell down?"
translation.ja: 事件のことを聞いても

translation.en: No one said, "What are you talking about?" "Oh, it fell down."
translation.ja: 人々は“そう”と言うだけ

translation.en: [Martin] That was the third… There were three buildings that fell down that year.
translation.ja: 同じ年に３件 倒壊したよね

translation.en: They fell down because no one took care of them. -[Martin] Nobody did. -I mean, so…
translation.ja: 誰も管理してなかったからよ

translation.en: It was just the way it was. I never thought about it.
translation.ja: それが当時のニューヨーク

translation.en: There were numerous things I was thinking about, but New York getting better was not one.
translation.ja: 町の発展はどうでもよかった

translation.en: New York was great. That's why I came here!
translation.ja: 魅力的だから来たの

translation.en: But, you know, I didn't come here 'cause it was clean.
translation.ja: 清潔だから来たわけじゃない

translation.en: I came from a clean place.
translation.ja: ここは汚い方

translation.en: I didn't think, "Ah, I want to go to New York. It's so spotless."
translation.ja: 欠点がないわけじゃないのに

translation.en: I didn't come here 'cause it was safe. I came from a safe place.
translation.ja: わざわざ安全な場所から来た

translation.en: I didn't come 'cause it was dangerous.
translation.ja: 危険であることは嫌だったけど

translation.en: I wasn't happy to be, you know, in danger, but I quickly acclimated.
translation.ja: 危険であることは嫌だったけど すぐに順応して70年代の習慣を受け入れた

translation.en: I have all the habits that I had in the '70s.
translation.ja: すぐに順応して70年代の習慣を受け入れた

translation.en: For instance, I sit on the subway, I see people put their bag next to them and they leave it there.
translation.ja: 地下鉄でかばんを脇に置いた人がいて驚いた

translation.en: I think, "Are you out of your mind?" It makes me want to steal it.
translation.ja: 私が盗もうかと思った

translation.en: You know, no matter what I'm holding… Really, it could be a pencil.
translation.ja: 私は何かを持っている時はたとえ鉛筆でさえも

translation.en: I have a death grip on it. "You're not getting this pencil from me."
translation.ja: 死ぬ気で つかんでいた

translation.en: Like, I would never leave anything next to me. Never!
translation.ja: 絶対に脇に置かなかった

translation.en: And not because I think people might think it was a bomb,
translation.ja: 爆弾と思われるからじゃない

translation.en: but because someone's gonna take it! Of course they will.
translation.ja: 誰かが盗むからに決まってる

translation.en: -[Martin] I've seen it. -That's what happens.
translation.ja: 日常茶飯事よ

translation.en: I mean, in 1971 or something like that,
translation.ja: 1971年かそのくらいの年に

translation.en: someone broke the windshield of my car,
translation.ja: 誰かが私の車のフロントガラスを割った

translation.en: which I still had my car from high school,
translation.ja: 高校の時からの愛用車よ

translation.en: um, and took, from the dashboard,
translation.ja: 高校の時からの愛用車よ そしてダッシュボードの上にあった

translation.en: an apple and a pack of cigarettes that was on the dashboard.
translation.ja: リンゴとたばこを盗んだの

translation.en: Um, a pack of cigarettes then cost 50 cents.
translation.ja: たばこは１箱50セント

translation.en: Uh… An apple, one apple, ten cents.
translation.ja: リンゴは１つ10セント

translation.en: I call the police.
translation.ja: 警察を呼んだ

translation.en: I call them over, they were still on the street then, I said, "Look."
translation.ja: 道端にいたからすぐに来た

translation.en: "Someone smashed my windshield and took from my dashboard."
translation.ja: “フロントガラスが壊されて盗難に遭った”と言ったら

translation.en: The cop goes, "What did they steal?"
translation.ja: “何を？”と聞かれた

translation.en: So I said, "I had an apple, a pack of cigarettes."
translation.ja: “リンゴとたばこ”と答えると

translation.en: And he goes, "Well, what do you expect?"
translation.ja: “当たり前だ”と言われた

translation.en: "I mean, if you leave these valuable things
translation.ja: “人が見る場所に何かを置けば”

translation.en: in full view of people, they're gonna break the windshield of your car!"
translation.ja: “人が見る場所に何かを置けば” “誰でもフロントガラスを割る”

translation.en: "Who wouldn't do that?"
translation.ja: “誰でもフロントガラスを割る”

translation.en: "What are you, a moron?"
translation.ja: “バカか？”ってね

translation.en: So, since he had a point, I didn't argue with him.
translation.ja: 結局 警察に同意したわ

translation.en: I realized, "Yeah, well, what do you expect?"
translation.ja: 確かに自業自得だった

translation.en: Apparently, there was that headline that said, you know,
translation.ja: フォード大統領が市民に言ったのは

translation.en: "President to New York: Go to hell," or whatever it was.
translation.ja: “地獄へ行け”だっけ？

translation.en: -"Ford to New York: Drop dead." -"Ford to New York: Drop dead."
translation.ja: “勝手にくたばれ”ね

translation.en: Meanwhile, who's dead?
translation.ja: 実際にくたばったのは？

translation.en: I also feel that, even though New York is not what it used to be,
translation.ja: ニューヨークは変わってしまったけど

translation.en: I really can't imagine they'd let me live anywhere else.
translation.ja: ここ以外には住めないわ

translation.en: I just think they would get together, there'd be some sort of city council,
translation.ja: でも市議会委員が相談して

translation.en: and they would say, "We've come to tell you, you have to leave." "You can't stay here."
translation.ja: いつか“この町から出て行け”と言われそう

translation.en: -That's what they kind of do with me. -"Sorry. Time for you to leave."
translation.ja: 今がその状況だ そうね 帰りましょう
